ISRCTN59775011  
Investigating the clinical and cost-effectiveness of two different drugs (amiodarone and beta blockers) to treat patients with new-onset atrial fibrillation whilst in the intensive care unit
query: cost effectiveness economic analysis amiodarone beta-blockers atrial fibrillation healthcare costs hospitalization reduction
title: Investigating the clinical and cost-effectiveness of two different drugs (amiodarone and beta blockers) to treat patients with new-onset atrial fibrillation whilst in the intensive care unit
reference: Holden, L., & Parekh, D. (2023). Investigating the clinical and cost-effectiveness of two different drugs (amiodarone and beta blockers) to treat patients with new-onset atrial fibrillation whilst in the intensive care unit. Birmingham Clinical Trials Unit, University of Birmingham. ISRCTN59775011.
